snippet: After 11-plus years of war, the American military faces a huge task in getting more than 600,000 pieces of equipment out of a landlocked country with bad roads.
abstract: American military faces daunting task in removing more than 600,000 pieces of heavy military equipment from Afghanistan as it carries out Pres Obama's order to cut force levels there by half throughout 2013; complicating picture are Afghanistan's poor roads and tenuous relationship with neighboring Pakistan.
lead_paragraph: After 11-plus years of war, the American military faces a huge task in getting more than 600,000 pieces of equipment out of a landlocked country with bad roads.

headline.seo: Afghan Withdrawal’s Main Hurdle: Getting Gear Out
headline.main: Main Hurdle in Afghan Withdrawal: Getting the Gear Out
headline.print_headline: Main Hurdle in Afghan Withdrawal: Getting the Gear Out
